instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi all,
i am French so sorry for my English. :-(
on this board I have <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> at 0,9v no 1.1v
also 0,9v on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> ???
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> 12.6v ???
I hopes the CPU is not dead but what we can test or mesure. I am not an expert

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: 0.9V is normal. Probably a dead GPU. Heat up GPU and see if it works again. After that dump it on Ebay as REAL new GPUs are nowhere to be found.

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi dukefawks
thanks
but there are no chime so do you not think that it is possible the problem was the cpu ? or near the cpu ?

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Just heat up the GPU and see if it works again. After that you need to replace it and that is where it all goes tits up.

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
no chime
does any solution to test if the cpu or cpu was dead ?
voltage or signals ?

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
ok today I just heat the cpu and there no one problem with the ram
on one slot I found many beep and no chime
on the other I can boot the motherboard completely 

I don't find the problem with the ram I think it is a cpu problem ???

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Does it matter? Are you going to replace the GPU? There are no GPUs to be found for these boards so this is a dead-end repair anyway.

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
I don't replace the GPU but one slot of ram don't accept ram it make some bip if I place one ram on it. But the other slot accept ram and the macbook works great with it.
I search where I have to look for this problem of ram slot

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
If you don't replace the GPU what is the point of continuing with this thing? Without replacing the GPU this thing will be dead again in a few weeks.

But anyway, RAM slots can usually not be fixed, just max out the working slot with 8GB.

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
ok thanks :-)
I wille replace the GPU but does it possible to install another version of the GPU (most recent revision??) ? Or just the exact same GPU will be recognized ?
and the RAM slot works before we heat the board so perhaps it is just the GPU ? Today I have just one slot working and the motherboard works great. I have read all curant on the two slots and it seams to be good so perhaps with a new GPU the slots works ?

threads.title: no boot no chime but green light and fan spins on mbp 17 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Must be the exact same GPU and they cannot be found anywhere at the moment. All the stuff on Ebay/Ali is fake!
